subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Macbeth
msgSnippet: ... If I recall correctly, www.freetype.org is your answer. Yes, you can, and millions of *nix/Linux users use FreeType to handle their TrueType needs..
messageBody:
On 2/16/2002 at 11:52 AM C. Paige Gabhart wrote:

>I have attached an example of Junior and Senior Quikscript to this
>post. I had to use an attachment because I got sick of Windows crashing
>all the time and switched to using Linux for my operating system. I am
>running Windows 98 in a window under Linux. I haven't figured out how
>to get Jerome into the Linux side of my computer yet. (I'm not even
>sure its possible since it is a truetype font.)

If I recall correctly, www.freetype.org is your answer. Yes, you can, and millions of *nix/Linux users use FreeType to handle their TrueType needs..

D.M.Falk
